With the highest score for popularization potential, Psidium guineense is a shrub or small tree occurring in South America
47 and Central America
48 , with wide distribution in Brazil
47 . From a nutritional point of view, the species, despite not having a high caloric content, is rich in fibers and micronutrients, especially calcium, magnesium and zinc
49 . P. guineense is also notiable for its content of organic acids, since among 13 species that are native to the Argentine Yungas, it obtained the highest citric acid content
